title: Dublin Murders, episode 5 review: the stakes were raised as Reilly's memories returned
text:
"I think I’m getting close," said detective Rob Reilly (Killian Scott). “Really close.” I’m glad he is because us viewers aren’t. Dublin Murders (BBC One) passed its halfway point with the truth still no clearer amid the two murder investigations, dual timelines and moral murkiness. Yet the killer combination of Tana French’s bestselling novels, screenwriter Sarah Phelps’s masterly adaptation and the two leads’ superb performances continues to exert its chilly grip.

Deep in the woods at the dead of night, despairing Reilly (looking more gaunt and tormented by the episode) finally remembered a fragment of his past which could be key to cracking the case: a brutal gang rape which he witnessed...
description: "I think I’m getting close," said detective Rob Reilly (Killian Scott).
